content: My name is Shashank Shekhar. I am an Electronics and Communication Engineering student with a strong focus on software engineering, data structures and algorithms, full-stack web development, and AI agents.

I am currently pursuing my degree in Electronics and Communication Engineering, where I have developed strong problem-solving skills through data structures, algorithms, and core computer science subjects.
My greatest strength is my ability to break down complex problems into smaller, manageable components and arrive at efficient solutions. I am also adaptable and learn new technologies quickly.
I sometimes spend more time optimizing solutions than necessary early on. I am consciously improving at prioritizing correctness and clarity first, and optimizing once the solution is stable.
I have hands-on experience with C++ for data structures and algorithms, as well as JavaScript-based backend development using Node.js and frontend development with React.

I have worked on multiple web-based projects, including an AI-driven email writing and sending application where users can generate emails from prompts, and other full-stack applications focused on practical problem-solving.
I actively practice data structures and algorithms, with a focus on writing efficient, clean solutions and understanding trade-offs between time and space complexity.
I am particularly interested in backend systems, AI agents, and building web applications that combine clean system design with intelligent automation.
I learn best by building and solving problems. I prefer applying concepts through projects and coding challenges rather than relying only on theoretical understanding.
I believe in writing clean, maintainable code. Code should be easy to read, reason about, and extend, especially in collaborative environments.
I take ownership of my work and am comfortable working independently. At the same time, I value feedback and collaboration as a way to improve both my code and my thinking.
